alert.note: Alert for Blount; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 6:43AM CDT until August 10 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Blount and Sevier. * WHEN...Until 945 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 741 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain due to thunderstorms had moved east. Minor flooding is still ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen during the last 2 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain may result in some minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gatlinburg, Pittman Center, Townsend, Elkmont, Roundtop Mountain State Park, Great Smoky Mountains National Park and Cades Cove. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
